Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk 389-ds-base
exit 0

exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: 389-ds-base bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated 389-ds-base packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. 389 Directory Server is an LDAP version 3 (LDAPv3) compliant server. The base packages include the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server and command-line utilities for server administration.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, deleting a non-tombstone entry failed when the generated tombstone was added to the cache. This update fixes the bug. As a result, deleting non-tombstone entries now works correctly. (BZ#1402030)
* Previously, when the master ran into missing change sequence number (CSN), the replication entered a fatal state. This update enables you to configure how Directory Server handles missing CSNs. For further details, see the solution provided in the references. (BZ#1402325)
* Previously, nsEncryptionConfig schema definition diverged between Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7. This was due to the schema learning mechanism not merging schemas with the consequence that replication failed. This patch adds the nsTLS10, nsTSL11, and nsTLS12 attributes to the list of allowed attributes in the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Directory Server's schema. As a result, the replication from Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 to 7 now works correctly. (BZ#1410080)
Users of 389-ds-base are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. After installing this update, the 389 server service will be restarted automatically.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
